title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Tate (Liverpool, England)
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to book the time slot for an in-person interview. Competency-based questions related to the job criteria on the job description. Three-panel members from different teams. very friendly. overall five to six questions.
Interview Questions: mostly related to demonstrating the skills

title: Corporate Partnerships Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Tate
Interview Descriptions: quick and good feedback at the end of the interview. interviewers often cut off before you were finished speaking, which I found quite rude. Personable enough, but were definitely looking for a certain 'type ' of person.
Interview Questions: had a corporate partnerships task which we had to present.

title: Events Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was relatively straightforward. I was invited to an online interview with a panel of 2 people I would work closely with, then an interview in person with a panel of 3. Standard interview questions with a prioritisation activity.
Interview Questions: Talk us through your work history Where do you see yourself in 5 years time Tell me about a time when plans have changed and you have had to adapt

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate
Interview Descriptions: After asking some basic questions through a telephone interview and some handling matters for restaurant service, I didn't find it very difficult, probably because it was only a part-time job.
Interview Questions: Describe your favourite dining environment that you have experienced.

title: Assistant Conservator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: For Sculpture and Installation Assistant Conservator. The interview was scheduled for one hour with half for a practical task (situation presented on computer to answer in bullet points) and the other for interview.
Interview Questions: Please can you tell us about your process for ensuring correct H&S is followed in your work, if possible, with an example?

title: Curator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Involved a presentation and followed standard interview questions which I understood they asked everyone as well as a few specific to the role. It seemed a fair and transparent process, although they did not do a second round of interviews as originally planned and appointed their chosen candidate.
Interview Questions: One of the specific questions related to how I view relationships with patrons and any experience in this regard

title: Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: 1 round in person interview, with 3 team members, asking questions about media knowledge and past experiences. Included one question about how you would deal with a journalist asking about controversy related to a Tate sponsorship.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this role?

title: Retail Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Was given situational scenarios to complete in groups. This includes introducing team members, creating a new idea attraction for the museum and picking certain items for a customer brief. Although the tasks were very easy, I gave it my best to answer every problem fully in the most creative manner I could. Especially, since it wasn’t a conventional interview standard it was difficult to prove competency. 

Ultimately, didn’t get the job. Wouldn’t have minded, but I just feel that “dumbing down” my answers or contributing minimally would be the only possibility I had of passing the interview.  

With such a informal interview approach, I believe they’d already made their decisions based on application. Would have just preferred a conventional interview approach over one that doesn’t really work. 

As a artist, am really disappointed with the result as museums are my favourite pastime. However ,it has given me the initiative to focus more on monetising my art and writing and working on developing a startup business.
Interview Questions: Scenario questions to do with what might happen in the store. Given a customer breif and was asked to select products for customer and explain the reasoning.

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (Liverpool, England) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online via applications portal. 
I was accepted for an interview that was a short 15 minute task - to compose an email for donors which was very informative.
Finally, I was invited to a  face to face interview after the task was completed. The interview was relaxed but formal with a panel of three staff members.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Visitor Experience Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (Liverpool, England) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: A 30 minute group task, centred around customer experience and crisis management. Followed by a 20 minute interview about views on gallery and museum experience, engagement, attention to detail. Very accessible and friendly interviewers.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us about a time when you’ve had to work independently? How did you keep yourself motivated?

title: Director of Education Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Tate
Interview Descriptions:
Online application requested 6x 2,500 word questions which should have really been asked in an interview. Some weren’t even worded as questions. 

 As I saw the advert quite late I didn’t have the time it would have taken to apply and I’m sure they missed out on other great candidates. 

They were not willing to have a phone call or provide an extension.
Interview Questions:
Question example:

“An in depth understanding of the contemporary challenges of embedding equality and inclusion in programming, audience and workforce.”

title: Artworker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: A series of 10 questions, similar to the application process. Two people interviewing, the design director and a senior graphic designer. They also asked about the task we needed to complete before the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an artworker at Tate?

title: Visitor Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was divided into three steps:
- a group interview in which you were asked to solve a problem in a simulation.
- presentation of a topic related to your passion/history
- 1 to 1 interview with two recruiters and a manager
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: not great but okay. Would not recommend for anyone having high hopes. Stay away if you are interested in development. Would rather look for better paying jobs. Too much working hours and not professional.
Interview Questions: Describe your interest in short words.

title: Corporate Partnership Account Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Requested to make 5 slide, 10 minute long presentation prior to the interview and to deliver it as though I was speaking directly to partners instead of interview panel.  I can see the value of this, but it was quite contrived and a little off putting to deliver.  I have lots of public speaking experience and even drama and theatre experience and it threw me off totally. Very time consuming process and panel seemed a little inexperienced and unenthusiastic. The follow up questions were very vague and not specific to my experience nor the presentation.  "What do you think of diversity" and "When have you been given a brief and how did you make sure you completed that brief" - way too broad. Valid questions and I was able to answer with lots of examples but it felt a little bit lazy. If you are asking candidates to spend a minimum of 1 hour to prepare a presentation - prepare a more engaging interview process.
Interview Questions:
How do you make sure you pay attention to detail 

Tell us about a time you were given a brief and how did you achieve that brief

What does diversity mean to you

title: Apprentice Digital Department Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Zoom call with 3 ladies who were really nice, before the interview they sent me a prioritisation task that I had to complete during the interview and talk through my answers after.  The task was pretty simple and you had to prioritise scenarios, and also draft an email.
Interview Questions: Complete prioritisation task, talk through your answers

title: Head of Programmes Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Tate in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
HR - very friendly and informative. 
Issues with the system meant I was not informed I had an interview, however they did push back the interview date to give all candidates fair opportunity. 
Presentation required for the interview. 
Interviews were conducted via Zoom. 
Requested feedback and never received.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Tate in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Very well organised. The team interviewing me made me feel very relaxed and the interview questions were very interesting - leading to an overall chat about the role. 

The interview was with 3 people and structured well. Gave an overview of the role and how the team is structured. Led with normal administrator based questions and then asked to speak more about myself and my personal experiences.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for Tate?

title: Visual Merchandiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: 3 stage interview process beginning with a phone interview and progressing to a practical/ presentation. A practical element was included in the second round which we were given time to prepare and execute during the interview. For the final stage we were sent a brief before hand to prepare what we were going to present.
Interview Questions: A practical task involving choosing a product type and how you would train staff members to merch in-store.

title: Visitor Experience Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: Role Play and Incident Management to test knowledge and steps to take in an emergency situation. There were 2 different incidence on top of the role play with further information given as the incident unfolded.
Interview Questions:
Role Play Performance Management
Respond to different incident types.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Tate
Interview Descriptions: A written online application about your experience, skills and motivation. Offered a one hour interview with two managers which involved a short presentation, competency questions and two-part written task. Interviewers were friendly and helpful
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Tate

title: Visitor Experience Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Semi relaxed atmosphere and welcoming panel. Very structured in terms of a difficult appraisal role-play given 10-15 mins preparation beforehand.  Felt unconstructive, circular and confrontational from actor. Moved onto easy scenario based Qs.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a bomb threat?

title: Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward.  I had to complete an individual task before the interview. I was interviewed by the hiring manager and another member of the team. They were both nice and friendly. Questions were mostly behavioral.
Interview Questions: They asked me to give examples of previous experience developing donors/clients

title: Sales Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very casual, however never heard back from them. I would have appreciated a callback. It was almost too casual, as it was hard to find a balance between being professional and laid back. The people who interviewed me were close colleagues and there was some joking and laughing. I can appreciate that but it's not what I had expected at this interview. They were obviously looking for the right personality.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were at the till and there was a huge line and a customer asked for help?

title: Membership and Ticketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The application is online, you then wait to be invited for an interview. The interviews include a 30 min task and a 30-50 min interview. My original task was to complete a mock reply to an email and to serve at the desk (tip is to look at membership and gallery map). For further interviewing (internal) you pick one of three objects from the Tate shop and then have to sell it to the managers. I know it doesn’t make sense seeing as that’s not our actual job but these are the hoops you have to jump through with Tate unfortunately.
Interview Questions: What would your friends say about you?

title: Assistant Curator, Programmes Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with three members from the programming & education team. It lasted roughly 30-40 minutes with probably 10 questions, all prepared in advance. Interviewers were generous and courteous in their feedback process. Tate HR was not very helpful.
Interview Questions: I was asked to prepare multiple possible public programmes and then answer standard interview questions about how I've learned from failure, collaborative working style, etc. Given the Tate's size, they seem very interested in ego-free employees.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Tate (Liverpool, England) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Friendly staff and interesting task to complete during interview. However uncomfortably hot interview room made it difficult to focus and a very poor phone connection made one of the interview tasks near impossible to complete.
Interview Questions: Examples of past instances when I demonstrated attention to detail

title: Assistant Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and submitted the day of the deadline, I then received an invitation to interview the following day. The following week I had my first interview with a panel of three members of the team I'd be working for, this interview was quite rigid as there were set questions to answer. 
The day after my first interview I was invited back for a second more formal interview which was a really great chance to have a discussion about the role and ask questions on both sides.
The afternoon of the second interview I was given a job offer. 

Overall the experience was very efficient and I didn't have to wait long to hear from the employer. The first Interview was a lot harder than the second because you are asked quite a few questions regarding specifics of the role.
Interview Questions:
What is your experience with Insurance and Government Indemnity Scheme? 

Why did you apply for the role?

Give an example of when you were busy and had to prioritise your work

Give an example of when you have to contact different people

title: Learning And Development Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview following a very long application. Prior to the interview, I had to prepare a small task for 30 minutes. I found the task easy. Very technical questions, the interview felt more like an interrogation - it lasted approximately an hour. Both interviewers seemed obnoxious and arrogant. I wouldn't like to work with such people so I was happy that I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: How would you approach a team?

title: Visual Merchandising Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: A rather long online application followed by two face to face interviews with practical tasks. Before the second interview I was provided with a brief in order to prepare for the practical task.
Interview Questions: What do you think the Tate are doing well in terms of their shops, and what can they improve?

title: Online Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly straightforward. I applied online via the Tate application website and received an invitation to interview a couple of days later. This position was for a Zero Hours Contract and they needed someone to fill in the position shortly after the interview. The interviewers were welcoming. They gave potential scenarios and asked what I would do in that instance. Standard behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you gave excellent customer service.

title: Retail Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Questions regarding previous retail experience.
Online questionnaire 
Face to face interview .
Applied through the website, vacancies are usually available.
Mentioned that a fixed contract was preferable. 
Brought passport to interview, DO NOT forget to do this, otherwise it creates a bad impression.
Interview Questions: How would you approach customers in the gallery shop?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (Liverpool, England) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great, and friendly. Was with two curators and office manager. Very relaxed and encouraging. Great. Really great. They also did a little task of reading press release for errors to ensure you can do the job
Interview Questions: Previous experience, a task and how you achieved difficult task

title: Waiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Intensive and in depth application followed by 4 hour trial and interview. You have to dress in black for the trial. You are paid if you’re employed. You can expect the fork test. IE. Check for missing cutlery.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Tate?

title: Exhibitions Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Half an hour Excel task, followed by a 45 interview  with a panel of three. The questions followed a similar structure to the ones asked on the application.  I initially was not offered the role, however, I was asked to come in 2 months later for a short interview and then I was offered the role.
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you work well in a team?

title: Events Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, first one included an admin based task. The initial interview was rather informal with two other people you would be working closely with in the team and the second was with more senior staff members. All were very friendly and made it as pleasant as possible.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Tate?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online application, interviewed by two managers, very casual and conversational. The interviewers were very friendly and I felt at ease immediately. Quick admin priority test at the beginning to test my time management approach.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you dealt with a difficult situation

title: Retail Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Thorough but enjoyable. There is a group interview for three hours, where prospective employees are asked to get involved in relevant tasks. They usually shortlist again and ask for a one to one interview shortly after.
Interview Questions: How will you cope in a fast paced environment?

title: Senior Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Efficient interview booking system. Mostly lunchtime slots. Was kept waiting for 15 minutes past the appointed time. Interview itself was conducted professionally. That said, the interviewers seemed slightly stressed and hurried.  

When asked to describe their culture they got a bit edgy (this is always a good question to ask an prospective employer by the way – if they hesitate and feel uncomfortable responding you know immediately that there are issues). When asked whether the 1 year contract on offer was a maternity cover they responded by saying that ALL new contracts at the Tate are now 1 year fixed term, no matter what the role.
Interview Questions: From which designers do you get your inspiration from?

title: Head of IS Solutions Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Single interview panel of 6 from different parts of the Gallery.  Asking standard interview questions around ability and personality.

Looking to see if had the ability to work with 3rd party suppliers as well as other business arms in a proactive integrated process.
Interview Questions: General Senior IT role questions

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I visited the Tate for interview, I was met by a member of the team who took me to the department's break room where I took an excel exam which I was told about ahead of time. I was also asked to complete a prioritization exercise, both these tests were given a time limit- I think 30 minutes. Afterwards the Head of Dept and staff who had previously been in the position interviewed me. Competency based questions, they made notes whilst I talked, wanted examples of what I had done and experience, no feedback or engagement simply question answer question answer, very formal.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Tate?

title: Retail Sales Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
- Online Application
- One on One Interview

I applied for the role of Retail Assistant. I got rejected and then I received a phone call from Tate HR. They offered me another role which was better than the role I applied for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Tate?

title: Retail Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: A very lengthy online application and if successful, a one on one interview. Then either a decline or an offer. In this case, I was firstly declined and then they verbally offered me another vacancy which was better suited for my skills. Always ask for feedback, if offered. I think that showed I was more than interested in the vacancy.
Interview Questions: Why the Tate? What can you tell me about your experiences ... give examples!!!!

title: Exhibitions Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough, but the interviewers were pleasant and seemed to take a genuine interest in my work and history. I was aware that applications for this type of position are very competitive so I wasn't expecting a job offer, but it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: What within your prior experience could you bring to the table at Tate to make a difference?

title: Development Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Tate (London, England) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: One interview, nice enough people and straigtforward. Interviews were from department and not HR, so had idea what they were doing, seemed abit nervous, despite me being junior. Took forever to give me the job, makes me wonder which runner up I was?
Interview Questions: Something about passion, what I hope to learn. Junior role, no complexity
